items.name: Ext.ZIndexManager
items.text: A class that manages a group of Ext.Component#cfg-floating Components and provides z-order management, and Component activation behavior, including masking below the active (topmost) Component. Ext.Component#cfg-floating Components which are rendered directly into the document (such as Ext.window.Windows) which are Ext.Component#method-shown are managed by a Ext.WindowManager. Ext.Component#cfg-floating Components which are descendants of Ext.Component#cfg-floating *Containers* (for example a Ext.view.BoundList within an Ext.window.Window, or a Ext.menu.Menu), are managed by a ZIndexManager owned by that floating Container. Therefore ComboBox dropdowns within Windows will have managed z-indices guaranteed to be correct, relative to the Window.

items.name: onCollectionSort
items.text:
Called whenever the zIndexStack is sorted.
That happens in reaction to the activeCounter time being set, or the alwaysOnTop config being set.

items.name: onComponentUpdate
items.text: Called from Ext.util.Floating updater methods when a config which affects the stack order is updated in a Component. eg Ext.Component#alwaysOnTop or Ext.Component#activeCounter

items.name: onComponentShowHide
items.text: Called when the global hide and show events are fired. If it is one of our components, we must re-sort.

items.name: register
items.text: Registers a floating Ext.Component with this ZIndexManager. This should not need to be called under normal circumstances. Floating Components (such as Windows, BoundLists and Menus) are automatically registered with a Ext.Component#zIndexManager at render time. Where this may be useful is moving Windows between two ZIndexManagers. For example, to bring the Ext.MessageBox dialog under the same manager as the Desktop's ZIndexManager in the desktop sample app: MyDesktop.getDesktop().getManager().register(Ext.MessageBox);

items.name: comp
items.text: The Component to register.

items.name: unregister
items.text: Unregisters a Ext.Component from this ZIndexManager. This should not need to be called. Components are automatically unregistered upon destruction. See register.

items.name: comp
items.text: The Component to unregister.

items.name: get
items.text: Gets a registered Component by id.

items.name: id
items.text: The id of the Component or a Ext.Component instance

items.name: bringToFront
items.text: Brings the specified Component to the front of any other active Components in this ZIndexManager.

items.name: comp
items.text: The id of the Component or a Ext.Component instance.

items.name: preventFocus
items.text: Pass `true` to prevent the component being focused when moved to front.

True if the component was brought to the front, else false if it was already in front, or another component remains at the front due to configuration (eg Ext.util.Floating#alwaysOnTop, or if the component was not found.

items.name: sendToBack
items.text: Sends the specified Component to the back of other active Components in this ZIndexManager.

items.name: comp
items.text: The id of the Component or a Ext.Component instance
The Component

items.name: hideAll
items.text: Hides all Components managed by this ZIndexManager.

items.name: hide
show
items.text: Restores temporarily hidden managed Components to visibility.

items.name: getActive
items.text: Gets the currently-active Component in this ZIndexManager.
The active Component

items.name: getBy
items.text: Returns zero or more Components in this ZIndexManager using the custom search function passed to this method. The function should accept a single Ext.Component reference as its only argument and should return true if the Component matches the search criteria, otherwise it should return false.

items.name: fn
items.text: The search function

items.name: scope
items.text:
The scope (`this` reference) in which the function is executed.
Defaults to the Component being tested. That gets passed to the function if not specified.
An array of zero or more matching floating components.

items.name: each
items.text:
Executes the specified function once for every Component in this ZIndexManager, passing each
Component as the only parameter. Returning false from the function will stop the iteration.

items.name: fn
items.text: The function to execute for each item

items.name: scope
items.text:
The scope (this reference) in which the function
is executed. Defaults to the current Component in the iteration.

items.name: eachBottomUp
items.text:
Executes the specified function once for every Component in this ZIndexManager, passing each
Component as the only parameter. Returning false from the function will stop the iteration.
The components are passed to the function starting at the bottom and proceeding to the top.

items.name: fn
items.text: The function to execute for each item

items.name: scope
items.text:
(optional) The scope (this reference) in which the function
is executed. Defaults to the current Component in the iteration.

items.name: eachTopDown
items.text:
Executes the specified function once for every Component in this ZIndexManager, passing each
Component as the only parameter. Returning false from the function will stop the iteration.
The components are passed to the function starting at the top and proceeding to the bottom.

items.name: fn
items.text: The function to execute for each item

items.name: scope
items.text:
The scope (this reference) in which the function
is executed. Defaults to the current Component in the iteration.
